fr:mainmatter.fr:p: (1) There is also a bijective correspondence sending subgroups H of \mathop {\textrm {Aut}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \mathbb {F}) to subfields \mathbb {L} of \Bbbk containing \mathbb {F} which fixes \mathbb {L} under H (i.e., for any \sigma \in H we have \forall x\in \Bbbk , x\in \mathbb {L}\iff \sigma (x)=x).
It may be tempting to conjecture these two bijections are inverses of each other, but that is not the case.
(2) This correspondence exists, but it is only a conjecture they are bijections. For this reason, this is a "conjecture" not a "proposition".
(3) These correspondences are known as "Galois correspondences".
